european group hits with a charge of  1.9 billion euros european group of companies on Monday announced a charge of 1.9 billion euros in the current account of its european subsidiaries to cover the losses arising from the bank losses it suffered in January. in January the group said it was closing down more than 30 banking and other services companies for financial losses that it estimated at up to 6.5 billion euros.
